Rapid deforestation in the Himalayan region of Alaknanda river caused floods in the 1970s and gave birth to a movement to save trees by hugging them. Read this heartwarming tale to learn the power of collective action as seen through the eyes of young Dichi.

category.label: The Little Bird in the Big Mountains

category.term: The Magic Powder - A Folktale from Myanmar
category.label: The Magic Powder - A Folktale from Myanmar

entry.title: Turtle Story
entry.summary:
Under cover of darkness, baby olive ridley turtles hatch from sun-warmed eggs on remote beaches. One of them, the little hatchling who is the narrator of our story, is delighted to make it across the beach and into the ocean without losing her way or being captured by predators.
But can our little olive ridley survive the dangers of the ocean? Will she make it past the deadly sharks and the terrible fishing nets and reach adulthood? Will she ever have the pleasure of laying her own brood of eggs?
Find out in this charming life story of an olive ridley turtle, and meet several other interesting creatures along the way.

category.term: Who is Afraid of the Rakshas Sweetie-Man?
category.label: Who is Afraid of the Rakshas Sweetie-Man?

entry.summary: Muzi loves to build with his toys. But when he leaves them behind to travel to uGogo’s house, he discovers something very special about the world. And he learns something new about himself.

entry.summary: Biju and his family are weavers in rural Odisha. They create beautiful fabrics to sell in the cities of India and abroad. This is the tale of Biju’s adventures when he accompanies his father to Delhi to sell the saris, and in the process impresses a city boy with his skill. Jaya Jaitly’s fun-filled story is illustrated by Bhramara Nayak in the patachitra style.

entry.title: The Tree
entry.summary: The tale of how a tree grows from a tiny seed.

entry.title: Billy to the Rescue
entry.summary: Putting out fires makes Billy the fire engine dirty. Will he still do his work?

entry.title: Hide and Seek
entry.summary: Dodo plays Hide-and-seek with mum, what can Dodo find?

entry.title: Marching to Freedom
entry.summary: Mahatma Gandhi and his followers have decided to march to Dandi to protest against the unfair salt tax imposed by the British. 9-year-old Dhani who lives at the Sabarmati Ashram wants to go too. This tale captures the spirit behind the momentous event that inspired millions of Indians to join the struggle for Independence.

entry.title: Three for Free - A Folktale from Taiwan
entry.summary: Once upon a time, in a little village by a mountain, an old man came to sell his dumplings. He sold one for one cent, two for two cents and three for free! As the villagers started gobbling up the dumplings three at a time, strange things started happening around them. Read this tantalising tale from Taiwan to see what happened in this village by the Ban Pin Shan Mountain!

category.term: Three for Free - A Folktale from Taiwan
category.label: Three for Free - A Folktale from Taiwan

entry.title: How Do Aeroplanes Fly?
entry.summary: Sarla wished she could fly high like an eagle or like an aeroplane. Of course you can fly, said her new teacher. Here, Sarla shares all that she has learnt about flight and aeroplanes.

entry.title: The Best House of All
entry.summary: Big, small, round, square, heavy, light... homes can be of many kinds! Find out why each home is different, and build your own home. Our little architect shows you how!

entry.title: Water Dance

entry.title: Why Does A Poori Puff Up?
entry.summary: Round, fat pooris are a treat in most Indian homes. Why do they puff? There is a whole lot of science behind this simple question.

category.term: Why Does a Poori Puff Up?
category.label: Why Does a Poori Puff Up?

entry.title: Naughty Dog
entry.summary: If you had a tail, you would wag it after reading this book. This book is one of the four books in the 'Animals Around Us' series.

entry.title: Have You Ever Climbed a Tree?
entry.summary: Have you ever climbed a tree? Riniki dreams of climbing trees all over the country. Join her as she scrambles, crawls and clambers on the jackfruit, the chinar, the khejri and other trees.

category.term: Have You Ever Climbed a Tree
category.label: Have You Ever Climbed a Tree

entry.summary: Join Keya the Soldier Crab as she explores the beach with her Ma, and meets many different crabs.

entry.summary: Mommy and Plek Plok, her little son are swimming in shallow waters in the sea. Plek Plok sees bigger fish playing happily in the deep waters and wants to join them. Mommy warns he is too young to explore the deep waters, but Plek Plok goes anyway. What happens to him?

entry.title: Our Beautiful World

This monster is making the planet hotter, and threatening the lives of those we share the planet with. How did we get here? And what comes next? This non-fiction book tells us why we should be hot under the collar about the climate crisis.

Ready, steady, go!

Meet the street dogs of Mumbai. The roads are their playground and they have made the city and the people their own.
The pictures in this book have been created using a combination of illustrations and photographs. The illustrations have been made by Sumedha Sah. The photographs have been taken by Hashim Badani.

Rivers know how to take care of us, but if we want a future with them, maybe it is time for humans to take care of our precious water bodies.

entry.summary: Prosy wants a cat, but she must find one that's the perfect size for everyone in her family!

entry.summary: Kaka, the wicked crow, wants to eat Munni's eggs. But Munni is a very clever sparrow. And so are all the characters in this popular folktale from Punjab.

entry.summary: It’s Tumi’s first visit to the park. She’s so excited, there are many adventures. She might even make a new friend.

entry.title: The Fascinating Fibonaccis

A century later, the same sequence caught the attention of Italian mathematician Fibonacci, who wrote about it. The Fibonacci sequence, as it began to be called, was straightforward enough - what made it fascinating was that this particular set of numbers was repeated many, many times in nature - in flowers, seashells, eggs, seeds, stars... Find out more inside this book!

entry.summary: Little Ritu is very eager to see her cousin. So she posts him a very special letter.

category.label: The Day the Vegetables Came to School

entry.title: Manikantan Has Enough
entry.summary: Manikantan’s Amulet can tell when he’s happy or sad, sick or well. It can tell him when to eat and when to sleep, help with his homework and let Amma know if he’s not feeling well. Is it magic or is it science? Find out what happens when Manikantan and his mother move to the Smart City from their village.

entry.title: Circles in the Park
entry.summary: Golu and Tama go to the park to play. What do they see all around them? This wordless book introduces circles, semi-circles and quarter-circles.

entry.title: An Adventure with a Water-Snake
entry.summary: Khan catches a water snake! In this underwater adventure, Khan meets strange creatures, makes new friends and even manages to save the day.

entry.title: Slip and Slide
entry.summary: The hills are covered with snow. Seven sisters are excited to go out and play. Join them on their adventure!

entry.title: Beloved Daughter
entry.summary: Natabo has run away from her home! Do you know why?

entry.title: Mr. Anand has an Adventure
entry.summary: Mr. Anand loves to go walking in new places. Every outing is an adventure to him. This time he thinks he has learnt a new language. Do you also think so?

entry.title: Tara's Treetop Adventure
entry.summary: A tall tale about a girl’s incredible adventure with laughing leaves, squeaky squirrels, and purple planes.

entry.title: A Friend for Little Goat
entry.summary: Little Goat does not really like going to school. The school is so big, and Little Goat is so little. But he discovers that friends make school a happier place.

entry.title: Rose and Rocky Go Green
entry.summary: Rose has a recipe to turn waste into plant food. Join Rose and Rocky in their adventures in this book about composting.

entry.title: How to Solve a Problem like Himani
entry.summary: In a tiny school in the Uttarakhand hills, Himani and her classmates learn how to solve real-life problems. The story takes you through her diary entries as she learns the steps to solve problems, big and small.

category.term: How to Solve a Problem Like Himani
category.label: How to Solve a Problem Like Himani

entry.title: A Library Story
entry.summary: Seema’s school will finally have a library. But they still need 40% more money to buy books. Join Seema and her classmates as they raise funds for the library and learn the concept of percentages.

entry.title: With You, Ma
entry.summary: Aadya refuses to do anything without her Ma - whether it’s packing a bag for their holiday to Assam or it’s playing in the river. Will this trip make Aadya more self-reliant?

entry.title: The Very Shocking Report Card
entry.summary: What would happen if report cards were not all about studying and writing exams? What marks would you get then?

entry.title: Manu Mixes Clay and Sunshine
entry.summary: Manu’s father and grandfather are potters, and Manu is learning the craft. This lively story depicts both the simple joys and the hardships of a potter’s life, from gathering clay and making pots to selling them in the city markets. Bulbul Sharma’s enchanting story is illustrated by Shanti Devi in the Madhubani style.

entry.title: Simple Counting
entry.summary: 1 ... 2 ... 3 Let's count the number of animals! Is 1, 2, or 3?

contributor.name: San srei nou ch nou ch

entry.title: The Cat in the Ghat!
entry.summary: This is a book that takes you deep into the jungles of the Western Ghats. A wildlife photographer sets out to find an elusive wild cat and meets a menagerie of fascinating creatures. Quirky illustrations pepper a funny narrative inspired by real-life adventure. What better way to invite you to join his quest!

entry.title: The Balloon Man
entry.summary: Chiku buys a balloon and also asks her friends to buy some. But her friends could not buy the balloons because…read more to find out!

entry.title: Gola Gola
entry.summary: Everyone wants a different-coloured gola from the mela! If only there were an easier way for Mariyu to remember all of their choices? A story that introduces the concept of Venn diagrams.

entry.title: Listen to My Body
entry.summary: Each of us has a wonderful body. But have you ever listened to what it tells you?

entry.title: Little Monkey's Lost Bananas
entry.summary: Little Monkey’s home is always messy. One day, Little Monkey feels hungry but his house is so messy that he cannot find his bananas to eat! He asks the other animals in the forest if they've seen his bananas. Do you think the other animals can help Little Monkey find his lost bananas?

entry.title: Samira's Awful Lunch
entry.summary: Samira doesn't like the lunch her mother has packed in her tiffin box. All her animal friends feel bad for her and offer her their lunch. Read all about Samira's lunchtime adventure...

entry.title: A Day at the Carnival
entry.summary: The three mice brothers can’t wait to visit the carnival. They ride toy cars, go on the Ferris wheel, and visit the balloon shop. After some time, they realize their youngest brother is missing! Where can he be?

entry.title: The Peacock's Dance
entry.summary: Hina went to the farm with her father one day. She saw a peacock dancing and started to dance as well. How did the peacock react? Read more to find out.

entry.title: No!
entry.summary: A certain little girl is in the habit of saying ‘No’. She says it a lot. In fact, all of the time. One day though, she is faced with a very tempting question and can’t help but say ‘YES!’ Perhaps saying ‘Yes’ isn’t so bad after all.

entry.title: Piku's Little World
entry.summary: Piku loves long summer afternoons, and dislikes dark summer evenings. But his afternoons become darker when, all of a sudden, there is no one to read Piku a story. Will Piku’s books remain unread?

entry.title: Think Before You Act
entry.summary: A man takes advice from his friend without thinking twice about it himself. Where do you think this will lead him?

entry.title: Rainbow Boys
entry.summary: Are all boys alike? Do they like the same things, should they dress similarly? Let's think about it.

entry.title: Daddy's Mo
entry.summary: What does Anu like the most about her dad? His Mo! Do you know what a Mo is? Actually, Anu likes everyone with a Mo. So much so that when she sees a Mo, she gets funny ideas!

entry.title: Londi: The Dreaming Girl
entry.summary: Londi loves to dream all day. But where will her dreams take her?

entry.title: Hungry on the Steps
entry.summary: Pranav is hungry. As he climbs up the steps to his house slowly, many others join the line behind him. Who can make him run up the steps?

entry.title: North, South, East, West
entry.summary: Shaana is travelling the length and breadth of the country with her parents, exploring the many landscapes and peoplescapes of India. She documents her travels in letters that she writes to her friends back at school. A book that explores directions.

entry.title: I Am Not Afraid!
entry.summary: A little girl goes out alone in the dark. What does she find? This book is one of the four books in the 'Growing Up' series.

entry.title: The Peacock Who Wished to Fly
entry.summary: Peacock is sad. He wants to be able to fly like the other birds. What happens when he starts collecting feathers?

entry.title: Amma, There is a Bat in My Sambar!
entry.summary: Suppi is not at all happy to see a bat flying about in his house. In fact, he is quite scared of the bat. How can Suppi and Amma get the bat back to her family?

category.term: there is a bat in my sambar!
category.label: there is a bat in my sambar!

entry.title: The Tino, the Rhear and the Biger
entry.summary: Tingu Tiger is not happy with his furry orange skin, so he exchanges it with Ranga Rhino. But when he wants his skin back, Ranga has already given it to Bubloo Bear! Will the tino, rhear and biger go back to being tiger, rhino and bear? Find out in this fun story about muddled up animals.

category.term: The Tino the Rhear and the Biger
category.label: The Tino the Rhear and the Biger

entry.title: How Heavy Is Heavy?
entry.summary: A stone is heavier than a feather and lighter than a rock. So is the stone heavy, or is it light? Can we know for sure how heavy (or light) a stone is? Find answers to these and other fascinating questions in this fun book about weight.

entry.title: Apu's Giant Earthquake
entry.summary: Did Apu’s singing cause the earth to tremble and shake? Or was it an earthquake? Find out more in this humorous and fascinating story about earthquakes.

entry.title: Every Minute Counts
entry.summary: Adil has a full hour to get ready and walk to school. But he is late every day! Where is he losing time? His friend Paro decides to help him account for every minute of the hour.

entry.title: A Little Monkey and a Fish
entry.summary: A Little Monkey and a Fish is a story about a young, playful, and clever monkey who learns to make his way in the world by mimicking his mother. Along his journey, he must decide whether or not to take some risks. What do you think he will do?

entry.title: The Doll That Bommakka Made
entry.summary: This charming cumulative tale celebrates the tradition of hand-crafted dolls, inspired by the South Indian Thanjavur Thalai Atti Bommai. Starting with a little ball of clay, we see the fine dancing doll grow before our eyes. The rhythmic descriptive words, stacked in a delightfully repetitive way, invite children to chant along. The vibrant illustrations complete the vivid imagery.

entry.title: A Tea Garden Party
entry.summary: Abha is going to the cool hills of Darjeeling. On the way she stops at a tea factory. She has so many questions! Is tea a leaf? Where does it grow? What makes it taste so good? Go on a tour of a tea garden and factory and find the answers to these questions with Abha.

entry.title: Peepre in the Postbox
entry.summary: Peepre the ant finds herself in a postbox! Share her journey to discover how mail travels from one place to another.

entry.title: A Tree's Heart
entry.summary: Did you know trees are storytellers? Listen carefully and you can hear them whisper many stories — of forest fires and rain, of summer and winter, of our past and future. Look carefully around a tree’s heartwood and you will discover many tales, like the one in this book.

entry.title: Why Do Bees Buzz?
entry.summary: Why can't bees work quietly? They buzz because there are some very good reasons to do so. Learn about the humble bees in this book.

entry.title: Up World, Down World
entry.summary: In a canopy forest in India, the Up World and Down World have always been suspicious of each other. But it all changes when Gopa the dormouse drops her book by accident on Fatima’s head. A story about the biodiversity of the canopy forests and friendship.

entry.title: One Big Cake
entry.summary: Domdom has one big cake, what is he going to do with the cake?

entry.title: The Girl Who Thinks in Numbers: Data Warrior Prukalpa Sankar
entry.summary: Prukalpa Sankar loves numbers. They help her see patterns and solve community problems. How does she do this?

category.term: The Girl Who Thinks in Numbers: Data Warrior Prukalpa Sankar
category.label: The Girl Who Thinks in Numbers: Data Warrior Prukalpa Sankar

entry.title: The Missing Bat
entry.summary: There was a cricket bat missing from Rehman Chacha's warehouse, and he suspected that young Ahmed had stolen it. A funny tale from Kashmir, the land of the willow trees.

entry.title: Manasa Collects a Rainbow
entry.summary: Manasa is on the hunt for a different kind of rainbow. Can she do it? Let’s find out. Join Manasa on her adventure.

entry.title: My Inside Weather
entry.summary: Sometimes our feelings are hard to talk about, but everyone knows how to talk about the weather.

entry.title: Our Friends in the Wild
entry.summary: Throughout time, people have shared a strong relationship with animals in nature. This non-fiction poem explores the many ways that animals help humans.

entry.title: A Dancer's Tale
entry.summary: Phyllis Spira was dancing by the age of four. That was just the beginning of her journey towards becoming one of South Africa’s Prima Ballerinas.

entry.title: Let's Fly a Plane!
entry.summary: Have you ever dreamed of being a pilot? Open this book, step into the cockpit and let’s fly an aeroplane!

entry.title: Suppamma Loves to Craft
entry.summary: Suppamma loves to build things out of recycled waste. But she doesn’t like paying attention in school, or doing homework. Can Suppamma become successful by following her passions?

entry.title: Wildlife in a City Pond
entry.summary: Wetlands in any city are seen mostly as wasteland, waiting to be built over. It takes a tireless environmentalist to show us what city ponds really are – magically rich ecosystems worth preserving. Based on a real-life experience, here is a story that introduces us to the delightful fauna and flora in the urban landscape.

entry.title: I Love My Mom
entry.summary: The girl in this story learns from her mother every day. Now she knows many things. Which of these can YOU do?

entry.title: The Quirquincho and the Fox - A Folktale from Argentina
entry.summary: A quirquincho and a fox are very good friends and spend all their time together having fun. But one sunny morning, the quirquincho decides to start working, while his friend, the fox, has other plans... Find out this what happens to them in this vibrant land of Argentina.

category.term: The Quirquincho and the Fox - A Folktale from Argentina
category.label: The Quirquincho and the Fox - A Folktale from Argentina

entry.title: Posto, Please Clean Your Desk!
entry.summary: Posto’s desk is messy. Crayons, pencils, paintbrushes and books are scattered all over. Ma wants him to clean it up. Read this delightful picture book to find out whether Posto cleans and sorts his desk.

entry.title: Sports Day
entry.summary: Lace up your shoes, drink some water, and get ready for Sports Day. Happy, sad, nervous, excited - the students of KV School are feeling so many emotions. Aska-lakadi-gala-galoo, cheer them, won’t you?

entry.title: Colourful Birds
entry.summary: Once upon a time, all the birds in the world were white. Only Grandfather Magic could change their colours. What did he create?

entry.title: Sahana Makes Music
entry.summary: Sahana’s home is too quiet. How can Sahana liven it up? She starts creating some music of her own. Listen in.

entry.title: Goldfish Genius
entry.summary: Neo’s new goldfish is a genius. But when Neo goes outside to play, the goldfish tries to follow her and ends up going on an incredible adventure.

entry.title: Achchachi's Bagbrella
entry.summary: Sahyadri lost her umbrella at school, again. Amma is going to be very angry. Luckily for Sahyadri, Achchachi is going to help her make a new umbrella. A story that introduces the concept of pie charts.

entry.title: A House for Mouse
entry.summary: Mouse is looking for a new house. Friendly animals offer to share their homes with him. But nothing is right until he finds his own little spot, warm and cosy.

entry.title: The New Road
entry.summary: Chapansi is worried about inswa when the new road is built. But the inswa have a plan.

entry.title: Inside the World Wide Web
entry.summary: Know how to send an email? Of COURSE! Then you know what the internet is, don't you? Umm... sort of. And you know what www means, right? Wellll... kind of. You are feeling a little silly right now, aren't you? Mmmm. Never fear, Nettikutti is here! Gather round to listen as our bright little friend unravels the magic and mystery of the ginormous digital brain called the world wide web.

entry.title: Peacocks and Pakodas!
entry.summary: From listening to a melodious Kajari to watching tiny waterfalls, and from the lovely scent of moist soil to the smell of Amma's pakodas, Meenu loves every bit of the monsoon.

entry.title: The Adventures of Akara and Linio
entry.summary: Akara is a standing line. Linio is a sleeping line. The two friends go out to play with their other line friends. What do you think happens?

category.term: The Adventures of Akara and Linio
category.label: The Adventures of Akara and Linio

entry.title: Busy Mother Hen
entry.summary: Mother Hen sits patiently waiting for her eggs to hatch. How long will it take? Is she going to miss the fair?

entry.title: Jungle Brew
entry.summary: Bulbuli had heard so much about the mysterious place in the jungle that everybody talked about but nobody had visited. Was she actually going to have the biggest adventure of her life with only Totaram for company?

entry.title: Every Drop Counts
entry.summary: Samir is on a mission to save all the water he can. His mission takes him to several houses where he learns new and exciting ways to make every drop count! Can he, with the help of his Mina Chachi, make a difference?

entry.title: The Grumpus Rumpus
entry.summary: Mama Wagtail is worried because her baby Grumpus does not know how to show that he is happy. But how do animals and birds show that they are happy? Find out in this wonderful story about animals and birds.

entry.summary: Mili the hermit crab has lost her shell. She combs the beach for a suitable shell, but all she meets is litter, people, and angry snails. Will Mili find a shell before it gets too hot?

entry.summary: Meet Durva and Dhrubo. And Dhrubo's wheeeeelchair. Join the brother and sister as they explore parks, markets, and many other places and have lots of fun together, just like siblings do.

entry.summary: Raza's father Rahmat Khan is the royal tailor to none other than the great Mughal emperor Akbar. When they go to the palace to deliver the Emperor's new summer clothes, Raza realizes that the emperor is not completely satisfied with his father's designs. Raza wants desperately to help his father. But what can a little boy do?

entry.title: Princess Bahati
entry.summary: Princess Bahati’s kingdom is facing a big problem, and the young princess has an idea that might help. But will the King and the elders listen to her advice?

entry.title: Fly By Bye!
entry.summary: In this wordless story, let's explore our world from the perspective of a fly.

entry.title: Hugs in the City
entry.summary: This is Jilly. Today, she hugged most of the cats in town!

entry.title: Dots
entry.summary: Dots, dots and dots. So many different types of dots. Big and small. Colourful, black and white. Do you want to see them?

entry.title: It's a Laddoo Party!
entry.summary: Mira and Mihir have a box full of laddoos. Just when they want to eat… DING DONG! Oh, a guest. They have twelve laddoos. How many laddoos do they each get?

entry.title: It Wasn't Me!
entry.summary: Mom is going out for five minutes. What could go wrong?

entry.title: That Night
entry.summary: Chaitu wakes up to loud and angry voices. The night is dark but a fire rages in the distance. Chaitu is terrified for her family, friends and home. Why are these voices so angry? What do they want? A story set in a world fed by fear and intolerance.

entry.summary: Have you ever wondered how a motorcycle works? It all begins with a kick!

entry.summary: Most grandfathers are content to lie back in an armchair and lazily read the day's newspaper. Not our tree loving senior citizen. He goes on strike for his beloved trees and a series of hilarious events liven up this entertaining tale. Read on to find out who saves the day and who saves the trees!

entry.title: Arun in Ruins
entry.summary: Arun and Arunachalam are stuck inside a mysterious old palace. The only way they can get out is by building an electronic circuit. But how will they do it?

entry.summary: Where is Aaji’s tail? A little girl keeps wondering why everyone can see her grandmother’s tail, except for her! 'My Ajji has a Tail' is a Pratham Books digital book and was one of the winners of the Retell, Remix and Rejoice contest 2017.

entry.title: A Very Green Day
entry.summary: Greeny has so much energy. She doesn't want to nap! One day, she decides to run away. After playing in the hot sun for a while, Greeny gets tired and wants to go home. But now she's lost! How will she get home to her dad?

entry.title: Emotions Come and Go
entry.summary: Look out for the emotions you feel and why!

entry.title: The Grass Seeker
entry.summary: As the weather turns warm, Room Singh takes his flock of goats and sheep and scales the Himalayas for fresh grass. With global warming a reality, this photo book traces the journey that a Gaddi shepherd has been making for the last 40 years.

entry.title: The Snail's Wonderful Journey
entry.summary: Cheta the Snail wants to take a bus journey. He tries many times to catch the bus, but it is not as easy as he hoped! Will his dream ever come true?

entry.title: Puppy Hears a Noise
entry.summary: A puppy hears an awful noise that disturbs his sleep at night. He tries to find out who is making the noise. Where do you think the noise is coming from?

entry.title: So Many Leaves
entry.summary: Some leaves are tiny, others are not. Some taste sweet, others bitter. There are so many different kinds of leaves around us. Leaf through the leaves of this book about leaves.

entry.title: Croak
entry.summary: There’s a frog in the classroom, warn the students. A frog is eating up masterji’s lunch. A frog is sitting on masterji’s chair. But masterji isn’t going to fall for his students’ pranks today.

entry.title: All About Beaks
entry.summary: Birds have beaks of all kinds, and they use them in many different ways. Dip in.

entry.title: Where is Lulu?
entry.summary: Where is Lulu and why is she hiding?

entry.title: Tree's Company: a play
entry.summary: Three stories about three special trees. A wonderful play about the importance of plants in our lives, with a strong message of conservation.

entry.title: The Cat Ate The Sweet
entry.summary: A fat cat wants to eat some sweets. What will the fat cat do to eat sweets?

entry.title: The Body Builders
entry.summary: Vava is amazed that his little sister knew how to make her hair, her lungs and her ever-growing legs when she was in Amma’s belly. Join him as he explores how the millions of cells inside us grow and build our bodies.

entry.title: Shh! What's That?
entry.summary: Tara and Dia are about to go to bed when they see something on the wall. A monster! Will the siblings be able to chase the monster away?

entry.title: Angry Akku
entry.summary: Akku is having an awful day and it’s making her very, VERY angry. Read this book to find out how Akku's anger melts away, and get ideas on what to do when YOU are very, VERY angry.

entry.title: Spider, Spider
entry.summary: How does a spider spend her time? Join this spider for a midnight walk to find out!

entry.title: The Clever Tortoise
entry.summary: The tortoise sees the monkeys eating wood apples and wants to taste them. But first, he has to figure out how to crack open the hard shell. Can you help him?

entry.title: First House
entry.summary: Long, long ago, when people lived in caves, two brothers in the northeastern part of India, now called Arunachal Pradesh, decided to build their own house. In a folktale that refers to the rich fauna of this region, we learn how the first house was built.

entry.title: Kheer on a Full Moon Night
entry.summary: Meenu wants to play a mrudangam, dham, dham dham, and do you know, Amma wants to learn to ride a scooter? The Dasara holidays promise to be a lot of fun!

category.term: Kheer on a full moon night
category.label: Kheer on a full moon night

entry.title: What's Cooking?
entry.summary: While Mira’s father goes to the market to buy raisins, the kheer he was cooking disappears. Who ate up the kheer while he was away?

entry.title: Miss Laya's Fantastic Motorbike Does Not Like Fruits!
entry.summary: Miss Laya the Games Teacher loves helping people! Join her and her fantastic motorbike as they vroom off on a fruit-filled adventure. This is the fourth in a series of stories called Miss Laya's Fantastic Motorbike.

category.term: Miss Laya's Fantastic Motorbike does not Like Fruits!
category.label: Miss Laya's Fantastic Motorbike does not Like Fruits!

entry.title: Nanammal and Kamalathal Travel by Road
entry.summary: Nanammal and Kamalathal love to travel. They need to catch a train to get to Goa. Explore different modes of transport with the two friends and find out if they make it in time to the station.

category.term: Nanammal and Kamalathal Travel by Road
category.label: Nanammal and Kamalathal Travel by Road

entry.title: Everyone Eats
entry.summary: Each animal has different food. Let's find out what they eat.

entry.title: A Big Day for the Little Wheels
entry.summary: The little wheels in Shazia’s new cycle think they are very special. What they don’t know is that wheels are everywhere, even when we can’t see them.

category.term: A Big Day for the Little Wheels
category.label: A Big Day for the Little Wheels

entry.title: Sweet Memories of Gutar Goo
entry.summary: Open this special album to meet Gutar Goo and his rocking family and friends. Join the pigeon as he steps out of his (egg)shell into a wonderful new world where he finds his flock and is embraced with love and joy. A tongue-in-cheek book that celebrates identity and of course, pigeons.

entry.title: King of Birds
entry.summary: The birds want a king, but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest, but a tiny bird tricks him. Do the birds get their king?

entry.title: Ahilyabai Holkar
entry.summary: This is the story of Ahilyabai Holkar, a queen who ruled Malwa for 28 years. Read about this ruler who made history with her deeds.

entry.title: What Shall I Wear Today?
entry.summary: On some days, it is so difficult to decide what to wear. The little girl in this story tries on many dresses before she finds the perfect one.

entry.title: How Bittu Bottu Got Better
entry.summary: Andy’s robot Bittu Bottu did everything for him, from his housework to his homework. But when Bittu Bottu got in trouble, would Andy be there for him?

entry.title: The Book of Stolen Secrets
entry.summary: Secrets are meant for sharing only with people you know and trust. But watch out for sneaky people who are trying to steal them!

entry.title: Manners in the Park - Spot the Difference
entry.summary: In the park we go and play, skip, skate, swing, make friends and run around. Sometimes we also litter, fight, trip and push our friends. Spot the differences with your friends, teachers or parents and find out how you would like to play in the park.

entry.title: Every Tree Counts
entry.summary: From the stately Deodar and colourful Coral to the majestic Banyan and common Pipal, the book takes children on a journey across varied landscapes as they count trees, and picture the uses of each tree. Look around you to find more trees, and learn what these terrific trees can do.

entry.title: Mummy's Glasses
entry.summary: Mummy has lost her glasses again! It’s up to Nimu and Mirchi to find them. But what else will they find on the way?

entry.title: Where is my bat?
entry.summary: Now and then you hear a child talking to himself and describing an event. And how vivid the sketch is! Where is My Bat? is one such lively account.

category.term: Maazee Bat Haravlee Maazee Bat Saapadlee
category.label: Maazee Bat Haravlee Maazee Bat Saapadlee

entry.title: Reeti and Mithu
entry.summary: Reeti's holidays have begun, but she isn't happy. She doesn't like holidays because she misses being with her friends. One day she gets a pet - Mithu, the talking parrot. Does Mithu become her new best friend? Read this heartwarming story of friendship to find out!

entry.title: Who's That in the Mirror?
entry.summary: Who’s that in the mirror? Manasa is going to do what she does best—find out.

entry.title: White Butterfly
entry.summary: The White Butterfly wants to go to school like the other butterflies, but he needs some school supplies. Can you help the White Butterfly find them?

entry.title: Bounce!
entry.summary: Kayal bounces her ball a little too high. Meet different people in the neighbourhood who try to help Kayal catch the ball in this counting book.

entry.title: Going Home
entry.summary: Why is the little girl in a hurry to get home? Find out in this sweet story.

entry.title: The Mighty Tethys Sea
entry.summary: A hundred million years ago, the Earth looked very different. Where there are mountains now, there used to be seas. Even the continents had different shapes altogether! But how did it all change into the Earth of today?

entry.title: Tok Tok
entry.summary: The food-loving king of Sonapur could not sleep because of a mysterious sound in his chambers. What could it be?

entry.title: Abebe and the English Boys
entry.summary: Abebe was a boy who loved learning languages.

entry.title: The Water Seed
entry.summary: When the rains did not come, the young men of the village went in search of water. One of them brings back a water seed!

entry.title: Lion on the loose
entry.summary: Do rainy days make you feel that the world is full of possibilities? The lion in the story certainly believes so! Read this story to meet him as he takes a rainy day holiday from the zoo and have as much fun as the children in the story. After all, the author maintains that this story is ‘almost true’!

entry.title: A Dog Called Shoo
entry.summary: “Shoo!” says everyone who sees the little brown dog. She hears the word so often that she begins to think it’s her name. Until a boy taking a shortcut home decides to share his lunch with her...

entry.title: Nin Wants to Get Dressed
entry.summary: It's Nin's first day of school. She wants to get dressed in her uniform for school but everyone is too busy to help her! Can Nin get dressed all by herself?

entry.title: Sitara Grows Up
entry.summary: Sitara’s family is going on a trip to see the grand Taj Mahal. But children who suck their thumbs are not allowed on trains! Poor Sitara. Will she miss out on an adventure just because she sucks her thumb?

entry.title: The Big Beach Clean-Up
entry.summary: Arzu loves the beach and is determined to restore it. But this is a big problem to solve! With the help of her friends and a little bit of maths, Arzu finds that all problems have their solutions.

entry.title: How to Be an Otter
entry.summary: An otter passes on wisdom to a group of otter pups. Listen in to find out more about these wonderful river creatures.

entry.title: Three Friends
entry.summary: Three friends decide to cook a chilla…read more to find out what happens!

entry.title: Where Is Your School?
entry.summary: Schools are not just for kids! On his way to school, Pintoo finds some interesting schools! Do you want to see them? Look inside!

entry.title: P.S. What's up with the climate?
entry.summary: It’s too hot. It’s too cold. There’s no rain. There’s too much rain. There’s less snow. There’s too much carbon in the atmosphere. Grizzly bears don’t know whether to sleep, penguins don’t know what to eat. Kangaroos are escaping forest fires, bees are groggy from all the pesticide. In a world overrun by the climate crisis, is it time to panic yet?

category.term: P.S. What's Up With the Climate?
category.label: P.S. What's Up With the Climate?

entry.title: The Hundred and Thirty-Seventh Leg
entry.summary: A millipede hurts herself. She needs help. Now, which is the leg that needs help? A delightful picture book from a winner of Sahitya Akademi’s Bal Sahitya Puraskar.

entry.title: Vegetable Friends
entry.summary: Ladyfinger is feeling sad. What can his friends do to help? Read more to find out!

entry.title: I want to...
entry.summary: This little girl loves doing things. Do you?

entry.title: Silkworm
entry.summary: Read about the journey of a silkworm in this beautifully illustrated book!

entry.summary: When summer comes, Unnie spends all of his time playing with his toys. After a while, he gets bored with his toys and wants something new to do. He notices that his neighbour, Innie, is never bored. Where do you think Innie finds these adventures?

entry.title: The Plant Whisperer
entry.summary: Young Jaishree loves nothing more than plants. She wants to understand them, which is why she decides to spend her life studying plants. This biography of ecologist Dr H Jaishree Subrahmaniam is a story of passion and gumption.

entry.title: Train
entry.summary: This story is about a day in the life of a train. Read more to explore!

entry.title: Our Encounter with a Snow Leopard
entry.summary: What happens when a girl encounters a snow leopard? On a summer day in a valley in Ladakh, Lobzang Le and her brother have taken their parents' livestock for grazing. They freeze with fear when they face a snow leopard, eyeing their goats. Read this amazing true story about coming face to face with the elusive big cat of Ladakh and how the children deal with it.

category.term: Our Encounter With A Snow Leopard
category.label: Our Encounter With A Snow Leopard

entry.summary: Muthulakshmi P. is growing very tall. Nobody can tell how tall she will be when she is all grown up. But what if her height doubled? And doubled over and over again?

entry.summary: It’s a beautiful day for a picnic. Everyone wants to join in the fun.

entry.title: How the Toad Got Its Skin
entry.summary: This tale explains why toads have bumpy backs and can live away from water.

category.term: How the toad got its skin
category.label: How the toad got its skin

entry.summary: One day, a real mouse met a computer mouse. Suddenly, a cat began to chase the real mouse and tried to catch him. What happened next?

entry.summary: Welcome to Khajuria – a village where young Kallu and his gang run delightful adventurous riots almost everyday. Join them as they grow wiser and wittier, happily roaming the village finding new things to do, and see what they come up with! Everybody in Khajuria knew about Munia's temper. Everybody also knew how stingy Mangu Mali was about giving away mangoes from the tree in his orchard. Now, Munia wanted mangoes...really badly and that too from Mangu Mali's orchard. Can you imagine a situation like this? Read on, to find out what happens...

category.term: Kallu's world 3 - Mangu Mali and the Ambia Bhoot
category.label: Kallu's world 3 - Mangu Mali and the Ambia Bhoot

entry.title: Where Is My Bat?
entry.summary: Oh no! There is a missing bat, and it just can’t be found. Can you guess where it is?

category.term: Maazee Bat Haravlee Maazee bat Sapadlee
category.label: Maazee Bat Haravlee Maazee bat Sapadlee

entry.title: Zanele Situ: My Story
entry.summary: As a young girl Zanele Situ was told that she would never walk again. Being in a wheelchair did not stop her. She worked and trained hard and became a winning athlete on the world stage. This is her story…

entry.title: At Home

entry.title: Your Body Is Yours

entry.title: Mona Loves Roti
entry.summary: How do you get puffed, hot and delicious Roti? Find it out with Mona!

entry.summary: Cheenu has a lot of fun helping his father. Sometimes, there is a special treat for him too!

One day, in a terrible storm, she gets lost at sea. Join Fatima on her incredible adventure on remote islands with wonderful marine creatures.

In this book, Little Brother wonders where the sun goes at night. Does he just go to sleep after a long day at work, or does he sink down into the ocean deep to make it daylight for the mermaids who frolic there?

category.term: Sister Sister Where Does the Sun Go at Night?
category.label: Sister Sister Where Does the Sun Go at Night?

entry.summary: Take a walk with Zakhuma, a brave forest guard who lives in Mizoram. As Zakhuma takes us through his forest, we learn about the different animals and what it means to protect the jungle.

entry.title: How Big Is a Whale Shark?

category.term: How Big Is a Whale Shark
category.label: How Big Is a Whale Shark

entry.summary: Spin along with Pambaram, the naughty top, which has a mind of its own.

entry.summary: This is a little poem about a conical hat. It is a hat woven from cane. It is used for many things. Would you like to know more about this delightful little hat?

entry.title: Vayu, the Wind
entry.summary: A nice story about this silent and always present friend, the wind does a lot of things without anybody's notice!

entry.summary: Strange things happen at Ballu the bear's birthday party. Follow him and Avanti the zookeeper as they get drenched in a rain of fish.

entry.title: Sister, Sister, Why don't things fall up?

Of course, Big Sister has the right answer in the end, but before you start reading this fun book to find out, tell us: why do YOU think things fall down?

category.term: Sister Sister Why Don’t Things Fall Up?
category.label: Sister Sister Why Don’t Things Fall Up?

Does he win the lottery and finally travel the world? Or does his life begin to crumble due to his thirst and greed for easy money?

category.label: The Tale of the Water Hyacinth

category.label: Cracking the Code: Women Who Have Changed the Way We Look at Computers

entry.summary: Two fruit flies are born on Earth and raised in space.

entry.summary: Baby is unhappy. What will the mother try?

Off goes Gadbad Das to find some water, but it’s not as easy as you’d think.

entry.summary: When Guddu, Golu and Dadi go to the mela and try on magic glasses, they discover a whole new world of colours. A simple book on how primary colours interact to form secondary colours.

Could it be a giant blue sari spread out to dry in the sky that makes it blue, or is it something else altogether? entry.title: Earth, Our Home
entry.summary: The story of Earth is the story of life. It is also a story of loss, one worsened by climate change. But while the climate crisis can be a story of devastation, the work being done to mitigate it, to adapt to it, brings hope. And reminds us, our future is in our hands. The verses in this book tell these stories, in the voices of the orangutan, the Hasdeo Arand forest, the Gangetic dolphin and the Pondicherry shark.
