entry.title: Clever Rabbit
entry.summary: Clever Rabbit lives inside a hutch but he wants to see the world outside. What can he do to get out of the hutch without putting himself in danger?

entry.title: The Green Bean festival
entry.summary: One day, while playing in the green bean fields at her grandmother’s house, Nam meets a new friend – a green bean seed. He invites her to meet his family and to join their festival. What new discoveries will she make on her adventure?

entry.title: Hope, Where are you for Kate?
entry.summary: The schools are closed and Kate from America is bored and wants the attention of her family. They are busy. What does she do next?

category.term: Hope Where are you for Kate
category.label: Hope Where are you for Kate

entry.title: Absent-minded Ajja
entry.summary: Ajja is getting ready for his evening walk. But he does not always remember everything he needs. Luckily, Sujju is there to help him out. A book that explores the concept of opposites.

entry.title: Moutushi's Song
entry.summary: Moutushi is a little sunbird who loves brightly-coloured flowers. Didima has lots of them growing in her flower pots. Moutushi drinks nectar from the flowers, and in return gives Didima a beautiful gift. What could this gift be?

entry.title: Child's Play
entry.summary: The villagers in Sookhapur have a great problem – the only handpump in their village is running dry. Fights break out every day and nobody has a solution. Wait, there is someone who might! But will the villagers listen to a little girl?

entry.title: Fati and the Green Snake
entry.summary: Every day is a new beginning for Fati, a little girl who tries very hard to do as she is told. In this story, Fati gets a surprise when she is collecting firewood with her father. Fati and the Green Snake is based on the real-life adventures of a girl growing up in northern Ghana.

entry.title: The Great Tidy Up
entry.summary: When Gogo takes a nap, Khwezi and Mzamo decide to tidy up. What could possibly go wrong?

entry.title: A Very Busy Year
entry.summary: There’s something special about every month of the year. Except the month in which I was born. When is your birthday? Do you like your birthday month?

entry.title: Tractor Gets Help
entry.summary: When the tractor is sick, his friends come to help.

entry.title: Kallu's world 4 - Hero Horoscope Man
entry.summary: Welcome to Khajuria – a village where young Kallu and his gang run delightful adventurous riots almost everyday. Sometimes they question village traditions, defy bullies or just go about their daily business, but Kallu and his gang are up for anything. Join them as they grow wiser and wittier, happily roaming the village finding new things to do, and see what they come up with! A world renowned 'Astrologer – Palmist – Tantra Expert – Futurologist – Numerologist...etc' is visiting the village. What could he predict other than the future... class test questions perhaps? Or perform a few magic tricks? What happens when Kallu's gang decides to check out the 'horoscope man'? No need to go to an astrologer to find out. Just read on…

entry.title: The Three Doof-Doofs
entry.summary: Have you ever wondered what goes doof-doof-doof in the night? This is a noisy bedtime story for a quiet night’s sleep.

entry.title: Nomvundla and the Chilli-Eating Contest
entry.summary: Nomvundla and Soko are off to the Chilli-Eating Contest. Animals come from far and wide to try to win the amazing prize. Who will win and get to take a friend to the Hamba-Hamba Funfair?

entry.title: The Mighty (Little) Hunter
entry.summary: A mighty little hunter is off hunting. Oh no, the mighty little hunter’s a little lost. How will the mighty little hunter find its way home now?

entry.title: Playground
entry.summary: They want to go to playground. How do they get there?

entry.title: Miss Tiny Chef
entry.summary: Miss Tiny Chef is only eight years old. She does things other little girls wouldn’t do. Armed with a talking mingling stick that shares all its great recipes with her, Kasini stirs up a special surprise meal for mummy.

entry.title: Two Hungry Boys
entry.summary: Two hungry boys. And ten cupcakes. Chomp chomp chomp!

entry.title: Get Me The Bucket!
entry.summary: Two brothers decide to go fishing. What kind of fish do you think they will catch? What kind of buckets will they need to hold their fish?

entry.title: Sabzpari's Jaltarang
entry.summary: The village elders believe she sheds green light and plays the jaltarang to bewitch innocent people near the village pond. Kaasni and Faizan decide to investigate if she even exists because they don't believe in jadugarnis and paris ! This lively play interweaves fantasy and reality with rib-tickling humour to establish the importance of a clean environment. Read it and get inspired to perform it for hours of fun.

entry.title: Cloud Ice-cream
entry.summary: Sarla and her kite are great friends. The kite brings Sarla a lovely gift. Cloud Ice-cream! Read this charming story of their friendship.

entry.title: Egg
entry.summary: Crocodile, Tortoise, Penguin and Chicken find an egg. Is it their egg? ‘Our egg,’ say the proud Mum and Dad at the end. Discover whose egg it is.

entry.title: Goat, Dog and Cow
entry.summary: Find out why the dog runs towards a car and a goat away from it!

entry.title: My Ten Friends
entry.summary: This is a story about things that come into daily use in our homes, which help us keep clean and healthy.

entry.title: Don't Wake the Baby!
entry.summary: Ever since their new baby brother came home, Zu and Zi are not allowed to make noise. But how can they be quiet when playing is so much fun?

entry.title: Have You Ever Heard a Whale Sing?
entry.summary: The underwater world is a noisy place. Read all about some of the strongest, largest and loudest singers under the sea — whales!

category.term: Have You Ever Heard a Whale Sing?
category.label: Have You Ever Heard a Whale Sing?

entry.title: Samira Goes Shopping
entry.summary: Join Samira and Mouchak on their unusual shopping trip!

entry.title: The Boy and the Drum (A Shorter Version)
entry.summary: A folktale about giving and kindness transforms into a lively play! This versatile and adaptable piece can be performed on stage or in the classroom. Hours of fun and learning guaranteed!

entry.title: Barefoot Kanu Dadu
entry.summary: Chinar loves football. She wants to win the World Cup when she grows up. One day, when she asks Ma for a new pair of shoes, she hears the story of Kanu dadu, who played against the British barefoot—and won.

entry.title: Rajmohana Keloth: The Bug Finder and Her Big World of Tiny Insects
entry.summary: When the rest of her class is napping, Mohana is busy watching an army of ants. When she grows up, she becomes an entomologist. Read about Rajmohana Keloth and her world of tiny insects.

category.term: Rajmohana Keloth: The Bug Finder and Her Big World of Tiny Insects
category.label: Rajmohana Keloth: The Bug Finder and Her Big World of Tiny Insects

entry.title: Who Threw the Shoe?
entry.summary: Someone threw the shoe at Crocodile's head! But who?

entry.title: Nangila's Courage
entry.summary: Will Nangila succeed where big strong men have failed?

entry.title: Bhabhloo Bear's Adventure
entry.summary: Bhabhloo Bear’s life is full of twists and turns and he moves forward with leaps and bounds… literally! Join him on his thrilling nocturnal adventure and find out many secrets about Himalayan bears.

entry.title: Kadogoo Changed His Life
entry.summary: Kadogoo is not the best student in his class, but he knows that he can do better. What will Kadogoo do to become the student he knows he can be?

entry.title: Rainbow Visits the Village
entry.summary: A boy spots a rainbow for the first time. Do you think he knows what it is?

entry.title: Eye Can See
entry.summary: Chanda, Tinku and Motu visit a laboratory and look through different lenses. They see distant stars as well as miniscule stuff up close. Let’s take a look through these lenses.

entry.title: Inku Chomps, Gobbles and Slurps
entry.summary: Flying food, crawling food, hopping food – no food is too crazy for Inku! Join Inku on her food adventures as she meets other creatures of the forest.

entry.title: Muna and Milan's Game
entry.summary: Muna and Milan have returned home after visiting the zoo. They are enjoying pretending to be the animals that they saw there. What animals do you think they visited?

entry.title: Amma, There is a Bat in My Sambar!
entry.summary: Suppi is not at all happy to see a bat flying about in his house. In fact, he is quite scared of the bat. How can Suppi and Amma get the bat back to her family?

category.term: there is a bat in my sambar!
category.label: there is a bat in my sambar!

entry.title: DOT - The story of a happy little book
entry.summary: Little Minnie loves Dot. She can’t do without it. But one day she grows up. What happens to little Dot? Jump right in to find out. This happy, heart warming story about loving books is bound to make every child rush to grab their favourite book.

category.term: DOT - The story of a happy little book
category.label: DOT - The story of a happy little book

entry.title: Anuradha Dances the Bihu
entry.summary: Bihu's just around the corner, and Anuradha cannot wait. But, there's one small problem — it just won't stop raining. Will Anuradha be able to go out and dance the Bihu with her friends?

entry.title: The Poor Lady
entry.summary: The protagonist wants to fly but cannot afford an aeroplane. She finds a stick on her way home. How will the stick help fulfill her dreams?
entry.dcterms:publisher: Readership for Learning and Development -- Soma

entry.title: On the Metro
entry.summary: Zeba and her Abbu are off to see the Qutab Minar. They are taking the Metro. Hop on, and ride with them.

entry.title: The coffee legend
entry.summary: Tells about the origin of coffee in Ethiopia.

entry.title: Ambi's Little Things
entry.summary: Join Chimik and her mother on a heartfelt journey of love, laughter, and tears. When they lose someone dear, they find courage and joy in the smallest things. Together they dance, sing, and celebrate life, even as they say goodbye.

entry.title: Gagan Visits Kamal
entry.summary: Join Kamal on a journey home through the city. Along the way, he discovers sounds and sights of the city, which are expressed using simple words in this story for early readers.

entry.title: Magical Rainbow River
entry.summary: A mother tells her children oh how rainbows came to be in the sky.

entry.title: The Biscuit Jar Must Fall
entry.summary: Prudence promises Micki and her friends that when they finish cleaning Micki’s room they can have biscuits. But when they are finished, Prudence is nowhere to be found. So Micki and her friends spend the rest of their day finding ways to reach the biscuit jar.

entry.title: Toothless Charu
entry.summary: This is the story of a little girl named Charu who is scared of pulling her loose tooth out. Read the story to find out how Charu becomes toothless.

entry.title: Disagreement Among Occupations
entry.summary: What happens when everyone thinks their work is the most important?

entry.title: Hauz Khas: A School by the Lake
entry.summary: Would you like to walk a secret trail? This book takes you down one in Hauz Khas in Delhi— through a garden, an old school, a mosque and some tombs.

category.term: Hauz Khas: a School by the Lake
category.label: Hauz Khas: a School by the Lake

entry.title: How Money Travels
entry.summary: The Rupaiya Paisa Series brings out many useful facts about money that will help children to use money wisely as they grow up in an ever-changing world. Money travels from one person to another, one place to another. Is it stored under a cave in a big bank? What is an ATM? Why do people pay tax? This is Book 2 out of 4 in the Rupiya Paisa series.

entry.title: Hello
entry.summary: Lolo has many lovely friends. They are Sun and Moon and Star and Bird too. She would love to introduce them to you.

entry.title: Bombay Ducks, Bombay Docks
entry.summary: It’s raining and there’s not much one can do outdoors. Come and listen to Aaji’s story about the Kolis, the original inhabitants of Bombay, their favourite fish Bombay Duck and the city’s magnificent docks.

entry.title: Good Morning, Good Night
entry.summary: Madhav and Yaretzi live on opposite sides of Earth. When it is night-time for Madhav, it is morning for Yaretzi. Why can’t they ever see the stars at the same time? Read this story about time difference to find out.

entry.title: Baby Giraffe and the Sun
entry.summary: Mother Giraffe works long days in an orange grove, sweating under the hot sun. Baby Giraffe wants to do something to make her more comfortable. So he comes up with a plan. He will get rid of the sun!

entry.title: Happy Maths : Time and Money
entry.summary: This is a mathematics book with a difference. There are more stories here than problems! So read the stories, absorb the mix of facts and fiction and enjoy teasing your brain.

entry.title: My Balwadi
entry.summary: Children always like to share their experience with others. My Balwadi shows how enjoyable the experiences can be.

entry.title: All the Missing Socks
entry.summary: Striped ones, jangly ones, neon ones — where do all the socks go? This charming story in verse will finally solve the mystery of the missing socks.

entry.title: I Need to Hide!
entry.summary: Piggy-bank is terrified of being broken! His friend, Na, loves him and takes excellent care of him. But one day, Mom suggests that Na break the piggy-bank to buy her New Year’s clothes. What will Na do?

entry.title: Chaku's Cycle
entry.summary: Chaku really wants a tricycle. How will Chaku find a tricycle as nice as Lila's?

entry.title: Gorilla Has a Party
entry.summary: Gorilla gets ready for a party. What does a party need? Lots and lots of hats! Place party hats all over the house with Gorilla. A vibrant book about spatial direction and party hats.

entry.title: Pig Leads the Way!
entry.summary: All the animals are hungry and the farmer hasn’t come yet to feed them. They decide to feed themselves. And that’s when things get wild!

entry.title: Zanele Sees Numbers
entry.summary: There are numbers everywhere, but Zanele can’t see them.

entry.title: Senzo and the Sun
entry.summary: The morning sun creeps over the horizon and peeps through the leaves, waking Senzo. Gogo’s rooster shakes his wings, stretches his neck and crows. Koek-a-loek-a-loo! Join Senzo and the sun as they journey through the day.

entry.title: Woof-woof!
entry.summary: Doggy wants to play, but Baby is scared.

entry.title: Aaji's Terrace
entry.summary: Every holiday we go to our Aaji’s house. Why? Our house in Mumbai has neither a terrace nor our Aaji.

entry.title: The King's Crown
entry.summary: When King Anawrahta looked up to admire the tall pagoda, his crown fell down. Read this story set in present-day Myanmar to see if the crown stayed on his head.

entry.title: Imagine
entry.summary: Pencils for a present? That’s not fun. But maybe it is – all you have to do is imagine.

entry.title: A Dress for Porcupine
entry.summary: Kooru the porcupine asks her friend Gethum the spider to make a beautiful new year's dress for her. Gethum tries, but how can she dress an animal with such sharp spikes?

entry.title: Dhyan Singh 'Chand': Hockey's Magician
entry.summary: The man who came to be called the Wizard of Hockey, Dhyan Chand, started playing hockey with a branch of a palm tree. What did he like to eat as a child? How did he prove Hitler wrong? Here is the story of a man who might just inspire you to pick up a hockey stick and play.

entry.title: Super Mummy and Super Super!
entry.summary: An adorable tale of a super family!

entry.title: What is it?
entry.summary: What is it? It isn’t like me. Do you think it’s dangerous?

entry.title: Joy
entry.summary: We can find joy in simple things. Read this story and you will know how.

entry.title: Rumniya
entry.summary: Rumniya and Nani are a cheerful pair because they know most things turn out right in the end. Read this sweet story about resourceful Rumniya!

entry.title: Frog's Starry Wish
entry.summary: Frog loves to gaze at the stars. One night he decides he wants to touch them. He climbs a rock, a tall coconut tree, even a hillock! But the stars are always out of reach. Will Frog ever find a way to be near the stars?

entry.title: Moo Moo Brown Cow, Have You Any Milk?
entry.summary: Does milk come out of a packet or out of a cow? When city boy Raju visits his Ajji’s farm in the village, he watches Ajji milking her cows. Raju loves the sight of the fresh milk frothing in the bucket, but there is something he enjoys even more. What do you think it is?

category.term: Moo Moo Brown Cow Have You Any Milk?
category.label: Moo Moo Brown Cow Have You Any Milk?

entry.title: Hungry Pod & Healthy Pod in The Big Cake Contest
entry.summary: Join Hungry Pod and Healthy Pod in the funny story of the Podville Cake Contest. Hungry Pod loves desserts and decides to make a delicious cake to enter into the contest. But uh Oh! Something has gone wrong. Read on to find out more.

category.term: Hungry Pod & Healthy Pod in The Big Cake Contest
category.label: Hungry Pod & Healthy Pod in The Big Cake Contest

entry.title: Water, Water Everywhere, Not a Drop to Drink
entry.summary: Gopal suspects the credibility of the line 'Water, Water Everywhere, Not a Drop to Drink'. This story takes both Gopal and the readers on a journey of discovering harsh truths!

entry.title: Honest Girl
entry.summary: Can an honest girl be tempted to steal?

entry.title: An Amazing World
entry.summary: Turbans are synonymous with cultural tradition of India. The story is an informational narrative about different kinds of turbans which are commonly worn in India. The turbans have been personified to introduce themselves one by one in an interesting poetic form. Vibrant, striking and colorful illustrations add life to the story.

entry.title: Curious Baby Elephant
entry.summary: Did you know that an elephant's trunk was really short? But then how did it become so long?

entry.title: What's in the Pot?
entry.summary: Sam can’t wait for supper. What’s in the pot? Wait and see.

entry.title: The Postmaster
entry.summary: The postmaster and Ratan, hailing from different worlds, build their cosy home on compassion and empathy. However, the postmaster has applied to leave the village. Read this poignant story by Tagore that explores a relationship without a name and leaves your heart aching for Ratan.

entry.title: My Home Holds Us All
entry.summary: What are homes made of? Sounds and memories, friends and animals, smells and colours. Join Bela as she welcomes you into her home, which is more than just a house.

entry.title: Why, Oh Why!
entry.summary: Here is a book that will make little readers make faces at each other!

entry.title: The Fish that Couldn't Swim
entry.summary: Have you ever heard of a fish that can’t swim?

entry.title: Crackers in a Pot
entry.summary: It is Ramapada’s birthday, Dashu’s greatest rival in school. Ramapada walks in with a pot filled with delicious sweets and shares them with everyone but Dashu. Dashu isn’t known to be crazy for no reason! What prank does Dashu come up with in return this time?

entry.title: Who Will Win?
entry.summary: A family of shapes is excited about the lantern competition. But they realize that if they want to win the competition, they will have to work together.

entry.title: Phani's Funny Chappals
entry.summary: Read this funny story about Phani's funny chappals!

entry.title: Colours (Tell me now series)
entry.summary: Often an inquisitive child asks his parents about the colours or shapes that he sees around himself. The 'Tell me ... now!' Series describes how interesting the questions and answers turn out.

entry.title: The Runaway Pig
entry.summary: Lalita, the pet pig of Mini Singh, clicks her heels and runs away! And lands right into an adventure where she meets unfriendly donkeys, big buffaloes, and snarly dogs. But nothing can stop her from having fun. After all, isn’t that what adventures are all about?

entry.title: Lucky Time
entry.summary: Two mice are determined to taste some jaggery kept on a stand. They try their best to snatch a piece of the sugary treat. Do you think the mice will ever get to taste the jaggery?

entry.title: Fati and the Soup Pot
entry.summary: Fati has always been a fast runner, and proves this once again at her school's Sports Day. When she returns home from school, she helps her mother prepare okro soup. The soup smells delicious and Fati is tempted! Fati and the Soup Pot is based on the real-life adventures of a girl growing up in northern Ghana.

entry.title: The Snake
entry.summary: Do you know about all the things a snake does? Read more to find out!

entry.title: You! Yes You!
entry.summary: Hi! I’m fighting a monster, and I need you to help me. Yes, you!

entry.title: The Evil Forest
entry.summary: Three sisters go to the forest in search of firewood, but only two of them return home. What happens to the third sister.

entry.title: Sharing
entry.summary: Rani and Bala are so hungry! But they don't like the food they get. What do they do?

entry.title: The Worst Best Friends
entry.summary: Lila and her cat are up to no good. They are the best at being the worst together, after all. A story about a girl and her cat, and the mischief they get up to.

entry.title: Zeba's First Letter
entry.summary: Zeba is going to write her first letter. To whom is she writing her first letter? Read the story to find out.

entry.title: Little and Big
entry.summary: A simple book on what is little and what is big.

entry.title: There's an alien in my house!
entry.summary: What do you do when there’s an alien in your house? Fight a foe or find a friend?

category.term: There’s An Alien In My House
category.label: There’s An Alien In My House

entry.title: An Unexpected Adventure
entry.summary: A boring afternoon turns into an exciting adventure when a little boy opens a book.

entry.title: Rhyming Grandpa
entry.summary: Grandpa makes a rhyme about everything he sees and everywhere he goes. He makes everyone laugh: baby elephants, pet owls, and children all over the world. He never stays in one place and is always on a go. Read what he sings about in this book full of rhymes and laughter.

entry.title: I See the Sea
entry.summary: When Chiku spills paint, Sonu doesn’t see a mess. Instead they find a whale, jellyfish and the whole ocean. Their imaginations soar as they dive in and splatter paint, juice and mud to create a whole new world out of mistakes.

entry.title: Decision
entry.summary: A village takes a decision together to change their lives for the better.

entry.title: Happy Maths : Measurements
entry.summary: This is a mathematics book with a difference. There are more stories here than problems! So read the stories, absorb the mix of facts and fiction and enjoy teasing your brain.

entry.title: Queen of Soweto
entry.summary: Basetsana Kumalo is a beauty queen, but she’s also so much more. She teaches us that true beauty is about having a heart filled with love and generosity. Her story shows us that if you have courage and determination, you can achieve your dreams – whatever they may be.

entry.title: The Village of Five Poles
entry.summary: After the Electricity Department installs five electricity poles in their village, the villagers are excited. But when the Electricity Department doesn't return to finish the work, the village is left with five empty poles. What will they do?

entry.title: Sister, Sister, Where Does Thunder Come From?
entry.summary: Little Brother's inquisitive mind is always full of questions for Big Sister. He knows Big Sister has all the answers, because she is always reading one big fat book or another. In this book, Little Brother wonders where thunder comes from. Is it the roaring of the angry giant who lives in the sky that causes the heavens to rumble, or is it just the wild biker gang up in the clouds that makes all that noise? Of course, Big Sister has the right answer in the end, but before you start reading this fun book to find out, tell us: where do YOU think thunder comes from?

category.term: Sister Sister Where Does Thunder Come From?
category.label: Sister Sister Where Does Thunder Come From?

entry.title: Kites
entry.summary: A group of colourful kites fly high into the sky!

entry.title: Ms Phone
entry.summary: Ms Phone is quite a character! Can you imagine having five phones, for communicating with different people?

entry.title: And Also!
entry.summary: Thabo’s make-believe world has no room for his little sister, Keitu. But she has other ideas!

entry.title: A Walk Among Trees
entry.summary: Trees have been growing on our planet well before human beings appeared on it. Without their comforting shade and tasty fruit, our earth would be quite a barren place. Take a walk among trees in the King's orchard to savour the taste, the smell and the legends associated with bountiful fruit trees in India. You will feel refreshed by all that you learn!

entry.title: A Royal Procession
entry.summary: Parvati and her brother Laxman live in Pataliputra in the time of Emperor Ashoka, but have never set eyes on their king. One day, they meet a man who works in the palace, and wish they could see the king as often as he does. The children don’t know it, but their wish is going to come true sooner than they think. And when it does, what a royal surprise they are going to have!

entry.title: Exam Fever
entry.summary: Exams are round the corner. And Ma is down with a fever. Everyone is fussing over her, trying to make her feel better. Will her fever go away before the exams?

entry.title: Gyalmo, the Queen of the Mountains
entry.summary: Koyna is in Spiti Valley trying to spot a snow leopard with her friend Lobzang. Gyalmo, the snow leopard, watches from a distance as they try their best to spot her.

category.term: Gyalmo the Queen of the Mountains
category.label: Gyalmo the Queen of the Mountains

entry.title: Jealous Anansi
entry.summary: Where does Anansi's jealousy lead him?

entry.title: Circles
entry.summary: Mother Vulture takes Little Vulture on his first flight. On their journey, they see a dying gemsbok. She shows her son that the end of one animal’s life is also the beginning of a new cycle for other creatures.

entry.title: I Don't Want to go to Sleep!
entry.summary: Nandi doesn’t want to go to sleep. No way! She wants to go on an adventure. Join Nandi as she lets her imagination run wild and free.

entry.title: Moon Pizza
entry.summary: No, Tinu doesn’t want broccoli and peas in his tiffin box. He wants pizza—even a moon pizza will do!

entry.title: Once upon a Coin
entry.summary: Banko discovers the beauty of coins when he sees his grandmother’s collection. Join Banko to find out the images that can be spotted on Indian coins.

entry.title: A Very Important Tree
entry.summary: Busi loves the big, beautiful tree outside her house. But her brother wants to cut it down. How will she stop him?

entry.title: Grandpa Farouk's Garden
entry.summary: Amir loves Grandpa Farouk’s garden. But it’s dying. What can Amir do to help?

entry.title: Tara and the Magic Glass
entry.summary: Tara’s best friend is amazing because it shows her the world in a new way. Join them on their larger-than-life adventures.

entry.title: Turtle Dove
entry.summary: Learn what Turtle Dove can and cannot do!

entry.title: Curly and Straight
entry.summary: Do you like curly tails or straight tails? There are some things we like whether straight or curly!

entry.title: Nichchumani Helps Out
entry.summary: Nichchumani wants to help Pichhu, a lost and injured duckling. She takes her home, but she only finds more trouble there!

entry.title: Where Is the Moon?
entry.summary: Where does the moon go during the day? Come, let’s find out.

entry.title: Going to a Wedding
entry.summary: Children always like to share their experience with others. Going to a wedding shows how enjoyable the experiences can be.

entry.title: Anansi gives people stories
entry.summary: Long ago, the sky kept all stories locked up in a wooden box. People asked clever Anansi to ask the sky god for the stories. The sky god agreed, but only if Anansi performed three seemingly impossible tasks.

entry.title: I Love My Planet
entry.summary: Loving the planet also means taking care of it. Read to find out how these children do their bit to take care of the planet they love.

entry.title: The Winter Night
entry.summary: Halku and his wife, Munni are rural farmers who find themselves crushed under the weight of poverty. Having lost their hard-earned money to repay a debt, they have also lost all the means to buy a blanket for the coming winter month. Halku is faced with the circumstance of sleeping out in his field with nothing to protect him from the harsh, biting cold. Having no choice and desperate for warmth, Halku and his dog set out on a cold winter night to guard the fields.

entry.title: Bravo Burli!
entry.summary: The wise people of the Kondh tribe live close to the forest. They know each zigzag path, each large sal and mohua tree, each pug mark of the mongoose and the tiger, and so much more! Young Burli is beginning to read the signs of nature, but is she ready to face the most dangerous ordeal of her life?

entry.title: The Man in the Moon
entry.summary: There's a man in the moon who wonders what life on earth with companions would be like! What happens when he ventures to find out?

entry.title: Fruits of Freedom
entry.summary: A grandmother tells her grandchildren stories that they can takeaway from!

entry.title: When I Grow Up
entry.summary: I don’t know what I want to be when I grow up. Can you help me choose?

entry.title: Raju and Muniya
entry.summary: What are Raju and Muniya up to today? Read more to find out!

entry.title: Tig's World
entry.summary: If the world is round, why don’t the people on the bottom fall off? Tig’s mom has one answer, and her dad has another. Who’s telling the truth?

entry.title: Kuwomba the Anxious Cloud
entry.summary: Kuwomba gets an order for a thousand sweets. She should be happy, but instead she cannot stop worrying. Will Kuwomba be able to make the sweets in time for the party?

entry.title: The Tortoise and The Rabbit
entry.summary: The rabbit and the tortoise decide to race. On the way, the rabbit fell asleep and the tortoise ran ahead. But then the tortoise saw a lion. What will happen now? Read more to find out.

entry.title: Lions are Always Brave
entry.summary: This little lion wants you to know that lions are strong, fast, and most of all, brave. But what is that storm cloud on the horizon? A story about who we are and who we think we should be.

entry.title: Sing to Me
entry.summary: Mama loves to sing all day, especially to Baby.

entry.title: The Dordles Find Fuel (Book 1)
entry.summary: Three creatures go in search of fuel in order to get home, but it’s easier said than done. The first in a series of three books about the adventures of The Dordles, who find themselves stuck in a world where resources are scarce.

entry.title: Porridge
entry.summary: Mom is away and Dad is making the morning porridge.

entry.title: Kottavi Raja and His Sleepy Kingdom (images only)
entry.summary: Kottavi Raja had trouble sleeping. Only at night. During the day, when his ministers discussed complex problems, he’d find himself nodding of f. He asked everyone for remedies. Nothing seemed to work. Until... Travel to Kottavi Raja’s land through this book and see what happened next.

entry.title: Maria's Family
entry.summary: Get introduced to Maria's Family!

entry.title: Lost in the Dark
entry.summary: Three friends go to fetch some firewood. On their way back they start playing and get lost. How will they get home?

entry.title: Spot and Spike
entry.summary: Meet Spot and Spike. Spike thinks Spot is boring and ordinary. Little does he know about Spot's clever little plan.

entry.title: So Much Work!
entry.summary: Chotu says that he has to do all the chores at home. Does he really do all the work, or does he just make a mess?

entry.title: Animals of Uganda
entry.summary: Which are the animals that abound Uganda? How do they look?

entry.title: Frog and Snake
entry.summary: Some friendships always have their limits. Find out how?

entry.title: Bon and Butter
entry.summary: It’s summer break, and Bon is bored. Nobody will play with him! Bon decides to throw a party. But whose party is it?

entry.title: Big Blue Bus
entry.summary: Ebei and his mother are waiting for the big blue bus. Where is it?

entry.title: From Pillars to Palaces
entry.summary: Dheera loves buildings. When Ma and Baba build her a little plane, she flies out to explore what buildings are made of.

entry.title: I am a Puppet
entry.summary: Who am I? Sometimes I look like an alien. Sometimes I look like a clown. I can dance and I can move. I can live in a glove and in a sock. I have a large family. Come meet me.

entry.title: The Maldhok in the Desert
entry.summary: Chaitan’s family seldom has guests. One day, a guest arrives. Why does his visit trouble not only Chaitan, but also his dearest friend Gagan? This is a tale of turmoil in the life of a young boy and a near-extinct bird, set in a remote part of Rajasthan.

entry.title: Thambu's Kite
entry.summary: Thambu loves flying his kite. One day, the string breaks while Thambu is flying it. What will Thambu do?

entry.title: Shambhu and Me
entry.summary: Raavi loves Shambhu, the calf. Come, let's see what Raavi and Shambhu do in the cowshed.

entry.title: Cow with one horn
entry.summary: Find out about an unique cow.

entry.title: Sleepy Mr. Sloth
entry.summary: He’s quite good at climbing. He knows how to swing. But sleeping’s his favourite, favourite thing!

entry.title: A Tale of Two Oxen
entry.summary: Meet Hira and Moti, two handsome oxen, happy and content with their loving owner, Jhuri. Hira and Moti work hard everyday, are clever, kind and best friends to each other. They stay together during times of woe and harmony. Their days are filled with work, love and juicy oilseed cakes. Until one day, when they are forcibly dragged away from home and put to work under harsh and inhuman conditions. Will Hira and Moti surmount all the troubles that come along their way and finally go back home?

entry.title: Chunu & Munu: Draw
entry.summary: Chunu and Munu explore the world of art by drawing, painting and mixing all sorts of colours!

entry.title: The Great Rifasa
entry.summary: Nothing seemed right in the Kabini forest — the monsoon hadn’t come and the human tourists in their safari jeeps seemed to have disappeared as well. The animals of Kabini get together to begin their own safari. A fun story, from a unique perspective, about the far-reaching impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic.

entry.title: A Rock, A Dog
entry.summary: Avi loves pretend-play. Join in as Avi turns into a rock, a koel and many other things in this book about noticing and recognising patterns.

entry.title: It's Not Fair
entry.summary: Aisha and Maria are best friends. Until, one day, their classteacher praises Maria for her singing. Then Maria gets the part of a butterfly in a play, and Aisha does not. Aisha’s heart hurts so much that she thinks it could burst. A story about envy and the confusion that comes along with it.

entry.title: Shanti's Friend
entry.summary: Do trees speak? That is what Shanti believes. Read this story of an unusual friendship ...

entry.title: Lion's shoes
entry.summary: Mischief most hurts the ones who cause it.

entry.title: Palm Tree
entry.summary: Palm tree wants tp leave its corner and fly away. Explore the power of imagination in this poem.

entry.title: Together We're Strong: The Story of Albertina Sisulu
entry.summary: From the day she was born to the day she died, Albertina Sisulu lived a life of love and sacrifice. A brave girl who rode a horse, she was a blessing to her family, to her community and to South Africa. This story of a unique and powerful woman, who stood up for her beliefs no matter what, will inspire and enchant.

category.term: Together We’re Strong The Story of Albertina Sisulu
category.label: Together We’re Strong The Story of Albertina Sisulu

entry.title: An egg for bride wealth
entry.summary: A young man is given en egg that is to lead him to his bride. He loses it on his way. Find out what happens next.

entry.title: When a Forest Wakes Up
entry.summary: As a roaring sun jumps out, the forest wakes up to a brand new day, putting on a new show. What will the forest be today? A story inspired from animism, an age-old belief of the Gond tribe, where everything from the sun to the rocks are as living as we are.

entry.title: Story Chikkappa
entry.summary: Whether children or adults, everyone loves a good story. If we think about our life, we can think of it as a story too. Now, can you imagine a ‘land without stories?’ How would life be different if there were no stories? What would you miss the most? Story Chikkappa is a heartwarming tale with whimsical situations and memorable characters that take you through the journey of how the land without stories transformed into a land filled with story treasures.

entry.title: Going to the City
entry.summary: A boy is visiting the City for the first time. How do you think his sights on the way will be?

entry.title: Rolling
entry.summary: Who can roll and who can not roll. Do they all roll together?

entry.title: The Walking Mountain
entry.summary: One day, a camel gets buried in a sandstorm. Only his humps can be seen. Two tortoises climb on the humps, thinking they are mountains. But when the ‘mountain’ starts to walk, the tortoises call him a ‘walking mountain’! After the camel is mistaken for a mountain several times, he goes in search of a real mountain. Does he find one?

entry.title: What the Dark Sounds Like
entry.summary: What do feelings feel like? What does love smell like? What is magic? Step into the overlooked world of the everyday. Look closer, listen deeper, and celebrate the wonder in everything.

entry.title: Gundu Fish and Kutti Fish
entry.summary: Gundu Fish and Kutti Fish are playing together when they're trapped in a net. Kutti Fish escapes but Gundu Fish is still stuck! What to do now?

entry.title: The Porcupine and Elephant
entry.summary: On a warm day, an elephant and a porcupine are locked in a silly showdown, each claiming to be the strongest and the mightiest. As they quarrel, an unsuspecting third party can’t help but chuckle at their antics. How will this squabble end?

entry.title: Bus
entry.summary: Beep! Beep! A day in the life of a bus.

entry.title: Animals Run Away
entry.summary: Four animals run away from their ungrateful owners to find a place to live on their own.

entry.title: Joongedai's Things
entry.summary: Joongedai does not keep his room clean. His belongings are scattered all over the place. All his things are angry with him for not keeping them in the right places. They feel unwanted and neglected. How will they convince Joongedai to keep his room more neat?

entry.title: Shunti the Sunshine Cat
entry.summary: Shunti the cat loves the sun. Dadaji does too! What is so special about the sun? Let’s find out!

entry.title: Pinku and Pankhu
entry.summary: Pinku and Pankhu do so much work all day that they are tired by the end of it. What do you think they do all day?

entry.title: Zera and Jojo
entry.summary: Zera wants to invite Jojo to his birthday party. Will Jojo come to the party? Read more to find out.

entry.title: Who Can Fly without Wings?
entry.summary: Tithi, Anu and Kushum don't need wings to fly like birds or dragonflies or butterflies. Through the power of play and imaginary wings, they soar as high as a kite or a cluster of clouds.

entry.title: Mr Mkhize's Quarters
entry.summary: A story about quarters and lunch.

entry.title: Line
entry.summary: Lines are around us everywhere. In our homes, and in nature. On land and in the skies and in the water too.

entry.title: A Little Help for Cumulo
entry.summary: Cumulo is embarrassed. Her ears are hot. Her cheeks are flushed. Can she ever go back to the park again?

entry.title: Flower blind
entry.summary: How does Chat, who was born blind, see a flower?

entry.title: Behind You
entry.summary: May has so much work to do but all her cleaning tools keep disappearing. What is happening, she wonders, and her siblings are not of much help. A hilarious story of mischief, and family love.

entry.title: No Fear...Come Here!
entry.summary: A rhyme bordering on fun and scare, the elements of emotion most relatable to a child, Sukumar Ray's nonsense verses should be read by one and all!

entry.title: Clever Cat
entry.summary: Safi is a clever cat! Find out more!

entry.title: Cyborg Dadu

entry.title: The Lost Duckling
entry.summary: Tharul wants to help a lost and injured duckling. He takes the duckling home but they only find more trouble there!

entry.title: How the Whale got his throat
entry.summary: The fish tells the Whale about a man 'of infinite-resource-and-sagacity.’ What happens when the Whale goes searching for him?

entry.title: The Happy Plant
entry.summary: I have a little plant. It dances in the wind and smiles in the sunshine. It is happy, just like me!

entry.title: In the Land Where Beetles Rule
entry.summary: What would happen if the beetles were in charge? Or if fish ruled the world? This fantastical poem offers a powerful glimpse into worlds where nature comes first.

category.term: In the Land Where Beetles Rule
category.label: In the Land Where Beetles Rule

entry.title: Lazy Anansi
entry.summary: The reason why spiders have long thin legs.

entry.summary: Climb the mountain with us! Look out for many tiny creatures… and BIG views. If we help each other, we can get to the top!

A story about migration in the face of climate change, and what home and family mean in a world that’s changing, faster than ever.

entry.title: Mama, What's for Lunch?
entry.summary: Join Thabo and his sister Tumi for magical lunches with Mama!

entry.summary: “What if there’s a monster under my bed?” Tumi is scared. Mama tries to show him that everything is okay.

entry.summary: There once lived a chicken, called Cikizwa, who was an orphan. What happens in the chicken's life?

entry.title: Rafiki's Style

entry.title: A World of Books
entry.summary: Four friends spend the days walking around and picking up old bits and pieces. Until one day a woman notices them and…read more to find out!

Meet Team Kuber, Team Dhanadhan and Team Chanakya in this book. They help you save money; they lend you money when you need it and they help you increase your wealth. How do people with very little money start a business?

entry.summary: My aunt the dyer dyes so many clothes. Read the story and find out about all the clothes she dyes!

entry.title: Sizwe's Smile
entry.summary: Today Sizwe learns that a smile is something you can give away without losing it.

entry.title: When Will the Power Come Back?
entry.summary: The children are not able to study because of the constant powercuts. They encourage Salim Bhai, the village electrician to do something about it. Salim Bhai has an idea. Will this idea solve their problem?

category.term: When Will the Power Come Back?
category.label: When Will the Power Come Back?

entry.title: The Parrot with a Broken Beak
entry.summary: Her father's pen calls out to Kasni. Should she, or should she not pick it up? After she uses it, she finds an angry father and an angry parrot. A tale with charming colours to make any child happy!

category.term: The parrot with a broken beak
category.label: The parrot with a broken beak

category.term: The Ant and Green Mung Bean
category.label: The Ant and Green Mung Bean

entry.summary: A little boy's fantasy of saving his mother from dacoits, this poem takes you on a brilliant fantastical journey!

entry.summary: Lida loves to draw! One day, her father comes home with a lot of vegetables. Guess how Lida brings the veggies together to make something very special!

entry.summary: The street outside Ramesh’s house is all dug up. Ramesh finds a water pipe peeping out of the mud. And then…such fun!

entry.summary: Rotting leaves, fresh lice, or even their own poop! Animals eat all kinds of things to suit their habitat and diet. Read about the interesting ways in which animals eat in order to get nutrients and remain strong.

entry.summary: The schools are closed and Nikau from Oceania has just shifted to a new neighbourhood and feels lonely. How do you think he triumphs his loneliness?

category.term: Drop By Drop Makes the Ocean

entry.summary: This is a mathematics book with a difference. There are more stories here than problems! So read the stories, absorb the mix of facts and fiction and enjoy teasing your brain.

entry.summary: I have two ears. Everyone has ears…Don’t they? How many ears do you have?

entry.summary: Nandi is wondering all sorts of strange things about the world. And it begins with a simple question: What if…?

entry.title: Did You Steal My Chestnuts?
entry.summary: Early in the spring, Squirrel finds an empty tree trunk that is perfect for storing chestnuts! Squirrel adds chestnuts each day to prepare for the upcoming winter. But one day, Squirrel discovers the chestnuts are missing! Do you think he will discover who took them?

entry.title: Bhabho the Buffalo
entry.summary: Bhabho the Buffalo had beautiful horns. One day, her horns got wet in the rain. Dirt blew in her direction and stuck to her wet horns. The next day, a bird flying by dropped a seed that fell on Bhabho’s horn. Soon the seed sprouted into a tree. What will Bhabho do with a tree growing on her horns?

entry.title: Tara Finds Her Stars
entry.summary: Do you like sleeping under the stars? Tara does! Join her as she makes an exciting journey.

entry.title: The Picnic
entry.summary: Five friends went to a forest. What will they do there? Let us read more to find out!

entry.title: A Miaow and A Roar
entry.summary: Vedika and Karan share a real adventure as they sit in Grandfather’s chair. Meet their friends, the lion and the cat in this fun story.

entry.title: Our Little River

entry.title: We Hope: Children on Climate Change
entry.summary: Earth is home. But the wonderful world we love is altered because of the climate crisis. Children across India share their feelings about climate change and how it is impacting their immediate surroundings and lives. Interpreted by fourteen illustrators, these powerful messages are a reminder to listen to the voices of the young.

category.term: We Hope: Children on Climate Change
category.label: We Hope: Children on Climate Change

entry.title: The Hare and the Tortoise (Again!)
entry.summary: Remember how the slow and steady tortoise beat the arrogant hare in that great race long ago? Now the two are back together again, and they have a task to complete. Each knows that he cannot do it without the other, but can these two big rivals work together?

entry.summary: The reader follows the wise ant as she talks about carnivorous plants, how they catch prey and why they do what they do.

entry.title: Ann-Nem-Oh-Nee Finds Adventure
entry.summary: Ann-Nem-Oh-Nee is stuck on her rock all alone. She’s looking for adventure and wants to see the world! But how?

entry.title: I Will Help You
entry.summary: When Mama Heron needs help, Lungile comes to her rescue.

entry.title: Life of Shoes
entry.summary: A story from the perspective of shoes. (This story was originally created at a storybook development workshop with 22 educators, in February 2019, in partnership with the British Council and Department of Basic Education, South Africa).

entry.summary: Thangwang the baby, and Bhalluka the bear, loved to talk to each other. Gaaa! Grrrr! Read this to see if you can understand them!

entry.summary: This is the story of a little rhino who lives in a big grassland. He loves to explore, but one day he strays too far from his mother and gets lost. Read on to find out how he gets out of trouble.

entry.title: Ajay of Agumbe and the Signal Snake
entry.summary: Ajay is off to work. His office is in Agumbe. His job is to find the king cobra. We can see the antenna he carries, but where on earth is the radio that transmits to it? Walk with Ajay as he follows the king of snakes.

category.term: Ajay of Agumbe and the Signal Snake
category.label: Ajay of Agumbe and the Signal Snake

entry.title: Petros and his Dog
entry.summary: A sweet friendship between a boy and a dog.

entry.title: Amara and the Magic Tree
entry.summary: Amara was walking in a park and came across a tree that needed water. (This story was originally created at a storybook development workshop with 22 educators, in February 2019, in partnership with the British Council and the Development of Basic Education, South Africa).

entry.title: The Lost Laugh
entry.summary: Spotty the Hyena has lost his laugh. How did this happen? Where could it be? And can the other animals help him find it?

entry.title: Squirrel
entry.summary: A day in the life of a squirrel.

entry.title: Where Do They Go?
entry.summary: In this book, find out where everyone goes!

entry.title: Pommy and Tommy
entry.summary: Everyone in Pommy’s family loves animals. Everyone except Pommy! Until one day she meets a dog who changes her mind.

entry.title: All About Teeth
entry.summary: Animals have all sorts of teeth, and they use them in different ways. Sink your teeth in.

entry.summary: Lenin makes juice for two unexpected guests on a hot summer day. Maybe you can help him serve them.

entry.title: I'm Not Scared

entry.title: Happy Akai
entry.summary: Akai needs new shoes. Will she get them?

entry.title: Starry Skies
entry.summary: We’ve all seen stars in the night sky. But where do they come from? Let’s find out!

entry.summary: Summer, monsoon, winter, spring — a poster about what seasons are like in different parts of India.

entry.title: Muchkund and his Sweet Tooth
entry.summary: In this tale, Muchkund and his bright gang of ghosts have a clever way of dealing with forest offenders

entry.summary: Payoshni wants to do something big, spectacular, amazing and fabulous for the Independence Day celebrations in Godavari Colony. But there’s not enough time and Bandmaster Totoji is not being helpful, either. A story about finding and pursuing one’s passion.

entry.title: Me, Myself & I
entry.summary: A simple book about knowing oneself and by extension knowing the others around you.

entry.title: Teju's Shadow
entry.summary: Teju is worried. Something keeps following him! What could it be?

entry.title: LIGHTS... CAMERA... ACTION! The life and times of Dadasaheb Phalke
entry.summary: “Watch people move in the magic photographs! A picture two miles long! Only three annas!” This is how a magician named Dadasaheb Phalke invited people in the street to come and watch his first film. Other actors in this amazing story about the genius of Dadasaheb Phalke, the Father of Indian Cinema, include a cook who played a woman and the first film editor in Indian cinema who happened to be a woman and his wife! If you are a fan of films, you are sure to be fascinated by this script of his life and the making of the first ever Indian film. It has all the ingredients of blockbuster!

category.term: LIGHTS... CAMERA... ACTION! The life and times of Dadasaheb Phalke
category.label: LIGHTS... CAMERA... ACTION! The life and times of Dadasaheb Phalke

entry.title: Eidgah

Little Hamid lives with his grandmother and is armed only with three paisa for himself as he sets out with his friends who are boastful of the riches they possess. While his friends endlessly buy sweets, toys and tease Hamid for his inability to do so, Hamid must make a choice for himself.

entry.title: Why Hyenas Limp
entry.summary: Find out the story behind the hyena's limp.

entry.summary: A drought leads some monkeys to live in a far off land called Tirlok. But the monkeys of Tirlok don't like these new visitors. What happens next?

entry.title: Pari's Polio Ravivar
entry.summary: Little Pari goes with her mother Seema to get Polio drops. Krishna Bua and the other ASHA didis help the villagers and make 'Polio Ravivar' a huge success.

entry.summary: It’s drizzling, and Appa tells Chiltari a story of the city of his childhood. And then father and son step out to discover a city where past meets present.

entry.title: An Ode to Cricket
entry.summary: An ode for all cricket fans, small and big.

entry.title: Hope, Where are you for Bo?
entry.summary: The schools are closed and Bo from Asia is staying with his Aunt because his parents are doctors who are at the hospital fighting the crisis. He is worried for them. What does he do?

category.term: Hope Where are you for Bo
category.label: Hope Where are you for Bo

entry.title: Black Hats White Hats
entry.summary: Who are hackers? What is data and why do they like to steal it? And can they ever be stopped from taking what doesn’t belong to them? Read on to find out!

entry.summary: Fossils can answer many questions about our past—about beasts that are extinct, early humans, forests that have become deserts. Learn about fossils from this book.

Dashu remains alone and walks with a sly grin and an all-knowing expression. Does he know something the rest of us don't? What mischief is he upto this time?

entry.title: Flying Home

entry.summary: Rabbit puts on a pair of horns to go to a horned party. What happens when the other animals find out?

entry.title: Luvi's New Look

entry.title: Cheep Cheep Drip Drip
entry.summary: The baby in this book hears so many interesting sounds around her. Can you hear them too?

entry.title: Rabbit Goes on a Quest
entry.summary: After narrowly escaping arrows, rabbit goes in search of the King of the forest to warm him about the attacks. Will he be successful?

entry.title: The Goat That Ate the Spinach
entry.summary: A story about naughty boys and a kind grandmother.

category.term: The Goat That Ate the Spinach
category.label: The Goat That Ate the Spinach

entry.title: Ilari's Jaiñsem
entry.summary: In the hilly village of Roibha, it's time for the annual festival. Little Ilari is enchanted by her mother's beautiful jaiñsem. Eager to wear one herself, she sets out to learn more about it from her wise grandmother. Join Ilari in her quest as she unravels the do's and don't's of how to wear a jaiñsem.

But, after a fateful encounter with Bei Rym-aw herself, they start to realise a heartbreaking truth–humans are harming the environment. What will the two do to make the festival a symbol of hope again?

entry.summary: How the tortoise got a hard shell, and the hyena got patches on his back.

entry.summary: Why does the kingfisher bird refuse to leave the river bank?

category.label: River or a string of clouds

category.term: RIVER OR A STRING OF CLOUDS?
category.label: RIVER OR A STRING OF CLOUDS?

entry.title: How Do I Grow from My Mistakes?

category.term: How Do I Grow from My Mistakes?
category.label: How Do I Grow from My Mistakes?

entry.title: Gulli-danda
entry.summary: Gulli-danda is the king of all games, is simple with no rules or bets or bats or nets. Steeped in the rural scene of India, it is free of any division and discrimination. As the narrator comes back to his hometown as an established engineer, yearning for a game of gulli-danda, somehow his status and wealth has crept up between him and his childhood friends from the village, taking away the wild essence and freedom from his beloved gulli-danda.

But one year there was very little rain and the crops were scarce. So the animals began eating whatever food they could find in the village. The villagers did not like this and started to chase them away. What do you think they will do to get out of this problem?

entry.title: Nokpante
entry.summary: Goddess Minima builds a Nokpante for her grandsons and decides to host a housewarming celebration. Seeking a brave human to join her and the other mites, they invite young Noro. Noro becomes the first human to witness and learn about the Nokpante.

entry.title: Sindiwe and the Fireflies
entry.summary: There once was a girl named Sindiwe Magona. She had a special gift for stories. At night, little Sindiwe’s grandmother told her magical stories about ogres and giants, animals of the forests and the little creatures of the veld. This was Sindiwe’s favourite time. See how she grows up to live out her own adventures and she travels over oceans to change the world with her stories.

entry.title: What Did You Learn about Your Friends?
entry.summary: In art class, Asma madam divides the class into small groups. Rohan, Anku, Sunil, and Ritu work as a group. They find out new things about themselves and their friends. How do you know yourself better because of your friends?

category.term: What Did You Learn about Your Friends?
category.label: What Did You Learn about Your Friends?

entry.title: Cilandikonda - I Enjoy
entry.summary: What does our protagonist enjoy doing? She lists them for you!

entry.title: The Root Bridge
entry.summary: The living root bridges of Meghalaya take decades to build. This is the story of a small root who aspires to be a part of one of Meghalaya's mighty root bridges.

entry.title: The Flyaway Cradle
entry.summary: What do you do with a cradle that flies? Join this bunch of clever children and find out!

entry.title: Little Dams
entry.summary: In a large forest, in a faraway land, there were many lakes, ponds and streams. The animals had a lot of water for use. What happened when they did not use water fairly?

entry.title: Abel and his sister's doll
entry.summary: A sweet tale of siblings fighting and making up.

entry.title: Lebo and Gogo's Tea Party
entry.summary: Lebo is excited to have a day of adventure with Gogo. When Gogo hurts herself, she can’t do anything that Lebo wants to do. What can Gogo and Lebo do to have fun together?

entry.title: Chicken and Millipede
entry.summary: An adorable tale on why chicken and millipedes are enemies.

entry.title: Where is Bhuri Bakri?
entry.summary: Chutki's goats run away in the forest. Her friends come together to help Chutki find the missing goat.

entry.title: What Can Rohan Do?
entry.summary: Rohan is in grade seven. He finds Maths very difficult. He is very sad. His friend and brother help Rohan see the many other things that he can do.

Through the tale, he goes on a journey filled with interesting characters and discovers the hidden secrets about the stones.

entry.title: How Night Came to Opio's Village
entry.summary: There is no night time in Opio's village. One day he goes hunting and arrives at a place he doesn't know. When night falls there, Opio becomes becomes confused and afraid. Then he discovers the truth and likes night so much that he takes it to his own village.

entry.title: Children of Wax
entry.summary: What will happen to the children if they are made of wax?

entry.summary: Someone is in Mama Antelope’s House. Who could it be? All the animals try to open the door but only Baby Antelope knows how.

entry.summary: Sindi buzzes with colourful songs and dance. Will starting school end all that?

entry.summary: When the elders are greedy for the food at home, how will the children react?
